segment.source: This content describes enhancements and supported configurations for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) 4.0 Service Pack 3 (SP3).
segment.target: This content describes enhancements and supported configurations for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) 4.0 Service Pack 3 (SP3).

segment.source: If there is a difference between this content and other AGPM documentation, consider this content authoritative and assume that it supersedes the other documentation.
segment.target: If there is a difference between this content and other AGPM documentation, consider this content authoritative and assume that it supersedes the other documentation.

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP3 supports the following features and functionality.
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP3 supports the following features and functionality.

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP3 adds support for the Windows 10 operating systems.
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP3 adds support for the Windows 10 operating systems.

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP3 adds support for PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP3 adds support for PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: For a list of the cmdlets available in AGPM 4.0 SP3, including descriptions and syntax, see Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack Automation with Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: For a list of the cmdlets available in AGPM 4.0 SP3, including descriptions and syntax, see Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack Automation with Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP3 includes a rollup of all fixes up to and including Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 SP2 and any fixes for issues found since AGPM 4.0 SP2.
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP3 includes a rollup of all fixes up to and including Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 SP2 and any fixes for issues found since AGPM 4.0 SP2.

segment.source: Ability to upgrade to AGPM 4.0 SP3 without re-entering configuration parameters
segment.target: Ability to upgrade to AGPM 4.0 SP3 without re-entering configuration parameters

segment.source: You can upgrade the AGPM Client or AGPM Server to AGPM 4.0 SP3 without being prompted to re-enter configuration parameters (called the Smart Upgrade) only from AGPM 4.0 and later, as shown in the following table.
segment.target: You can upgrade the AGPM Client or AGPM Server to AGPM 4.0 SP3 without being prompted to re-enter configuration parameters (called the Smart Upgrade) only from AGPM 4.0 and later, as shown in the following table.

segment.source: If you are upgrading to AGPM 4.0 SP3 from other versions of AGPM, as shown in the table, you must use the Classic Upgrade, which requires you to re-enter the configuration parameters.
segment.target: If you are upgrading to AGPM 4.0 SP3 from other versions of AGPM, as shown in the table, you must use the Classic Upgrade, which requires you to re-enter the configuration parameters.

segment.source: Because each version of AGPM is associated with a particular operating system, see Choosing Which Version of AGPM to Install and make sure that you upgrade your operating system as appropriate before you upgrade AGPM.
segment.target: Because each version of AGPM is associated with a particular operating system, see Choosing Which Version of AGPM to Install and make sure that you upgrade your operating system as appropriate before you upgrade AGPM.

segment.source: AGPM version from which you can upgrade
segment.target: AGPM version from which you can upgrade

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP3 supports the configurations in the following table.
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP3 supports the configurations in the following table.

segment.source: Although AGPM supports mixed configurations, we strongly recommend that you run the AGPM Client and AGPM Server on the same operating system line—for example, Windows 10 only, Windows 8.1 with Windows Server 2012 R2, and so on.
segment.target: Although AGPM supports mixed configurations, we strongly recommend that you run the AGPM Client and AGPM Server on the same operating system line—for example, Windows 10 only, Windows 8.1 with Windows Server 2012 R2, and so on.

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP3 supported operating systems and policy settings
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP3 supported operating systems and policy settings

segment.source: Supported configurations for the AGPM Server
segment.target: Supported configurations for the AGPM Server

segment.source: Supported configurations for the AGPM Client
segment.target: Supported configurations for the AGPM Client

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, Windows 8.1, or Windows 8
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, Windows 8.1, or Windows 8

segment.source: Supported, but cannot edit policy settings or preference items that exist only in Windows 8.1
segment.target: Supported, but cannot edit policy settings or preference items that exist only in Windows 8.1

segment.source: Supported, but cannot edit policy settings or preference items that exist only in Windows 8.1 or Windows 8
segment.target: Supported, but cannot edit policy settings or preference items that exist only in Windows 8.1 or Windows 8

segment.source: Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 8, or Windows 7
segment.target: Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 8, or Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 or Windows Vista with Service Pack 1 (SP1)
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 or Windows Vista with Service Pack 1 (SP1)

segment.source: Supported, but cannot edit policy settings or preference items that exist only in Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, or Windows 7
segment.target: Supported, but cannot edit policy settings or preference items that exist only in Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, or Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 or Windows Vista with SP1
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 or Windows Vista with SP1

segment.source: Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 8, or Windows 7
segment.target: Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 8, or Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 or Windows Vista with SP1
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 or Windows Vista with SP1

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 or Windows Vista with SP1
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 or Windows Vista with SP1

segment.source: Supported, but cannot report or edit policy settings or preference items that exist only in Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, or Windows 7
segment.target: Supported, but cannot report or edit policy settings or preference items that exist only in Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, or Windows 7

segment.source: The following table describes the behavior of AGPM 4.0 SP3 Client and Server installers when the .NET Framework 4.5.1, PowerShell 3.0, or the GPMC in the Remote Server Administration Tools is missing.
segment.target: The following table describes the behavior of AGPM 4.0 SP3 Client and Server installers when the .NET Framework 4.5.1, PowerShell 3.0, or the GPMC in the Remote Server Administration Tools is missing.

segment.source: If the .NET Framework 4.5.1 is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If the .NET Framework 4.5.1 is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If Powershell 3.0 is not installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If Powershell 3.0 is not installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If the GPMC is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If the GPMC is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If the .NET Framework 4.5.1 is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If the .NET Framework 4.5.1 is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If the GPMC is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If the GPMC is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If the .NET Framework 4.5.1 is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If the .NET Framework 4.5.1 is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If Powershell 3.0 is not installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If Powershell 3.0 is not installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If the GPMC is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If the GPMC is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If the .NET Framework 4.5.1 is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If the .NET Framework 4.5.1 is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If the GPMC is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If the GPMC is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If the .NET Framework 4.5.1 is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If the .NET Framework 4.5.1 is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If Powershell 3.0 is not installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If Powershell 3.0 is not installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If the GPMC is not enabled, the installer enables it during the installation.
segment.target: If the GPMC is not enabled, the installer enables it during the installation.

segment.source: If the .NET Framework 4.5.1 is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.
segment.target: If the .NET Framework 4.5.1 is not enabled or installed, the installer blocks the installation.

segment.source: If the GPMC is not enabled, the installer enables it during the installation.
segment.target: If the GPMC is not enabled, the installer enables it during the installation.

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP3 is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP3 is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).

segment.source: MDOP is part of Microsoft Software Assurance.
segment.target: MDOP is part of Microsoft Software Assurance.

segment.source: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=322049).
segment.target: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=322049).
